frontmatter.titlepage:
Pickett Family Letters, 1914, n.d.
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms2013-072
Special Collections, Virginia Tech 2013 &contact;
Processed by: Nicole Hancock, Student Assistant and Kira A. Dietz, Archivist,
Special Collections

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection contains condolence letters written to Mr. and Mrs. W. F. Pickett about the death of their son Chester in 1914.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Pickett Family Letters must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Pickett Family Letters, Ms2013-070, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was acquired by Special Collections before 2006.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Pickett Family Letters was completed in September 2013.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Chester H. Pickett was born in Ohio in 1893. He died in Bluefield, West Virginia in 1914. His parents were William Franklin Pickett (1858-1925) and Mary Emma Tate Pickett (1865-1949). Besides Chester, William and Mary had four other children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains condolence letters written to Mr. and Mrs. W. F. Pickett about the death of their son Chester in 1914. It also contains a condolence letter written to Mrs. Pickett about the death of someone else in the family. The collection also contains calling cards of "C. H. Pickett."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in chronological order. The undated materials are at the end.
